newsitem.title: USA: WorldCom shares tumble on dilution concern.
newsitem.headline: WorldCom shares tumble on dilution concern.

text.p: Shares of WorldCom Inc fell sharply at midday after the company said its proposed acquisition of MFS Communications Co Inc would dilute earnings for three years.

Although the transaction is viewed as a fundamentally strong move that will transform WorldCom into a leading telecommunications company, concerns about dilution in the capital-intensive sector unsettled investors.
"Over time, I think the deal will be viewed very positively, but it will take time," one takeover trader said.
Shares of WorldCom fell four to 22-3/8. Shares of MFS jumped 8-3/4 to 43-3/4.

Although the transaction was valued at $14 billion, or $55.39 per share, based on Friday's closing price, the steep drop in WorldCom's stock brought the value down to $47 per share, takeover traders said.
Shares of other related companies also rose on views that merger fever has spread through the sector. PSINet gained 3/4 to 11-3/4, and ICG Communications Inc jumped 2-3/4 to 23-5/8.
